html: We’re told that we just had a #PeoplesVote so are not entitled to another. In March it will be 2yrs, 9mnth since the ref. Since 1964, we’ve had 15 GEs = 1 every 2.9 years. If voters had the right to change their minds more often than every 3yrs - why is it any different now?

html: 59' #Notts 3-2 Stevenage Stead goes close on the volley. Hemmings switched the ball out to Enzio who beat his man around the outside and floated a cross to Stead but his volley was wide of the mark and Enzio was offside as he looked to turn it in.
text:
59' #Notts 3-2 Stevenage

Stead goes close on the volley. Hemmings switched the ball out to Enzio who beat his man around the outside and floated a cross to Stead but his volley was wide of the mark and Enzio was offside as he looked to turn it in.

html: Democracy isn’t endlessly static. It didn’t grind to a halt on 23rd June 2016. When information comes to light, and the promises of the Leave campaign prove to be false, people must be allowed to examine the facts, and think again.
text: Democracy isn’t endlessly static. It didn’t grind to a halt on 23rd June 2016. When information comes to light, and the promises of the Leave campaign prove to be false, people must be allowed to examine the facts, and think again.

html: No one is reneging on the result of the 2016 referendum. We acknowledge that just over half the people who voted, voted Leave. But it’s now over 2 years since the most recent referendum, and more and more information has come to light.
text:
No one is reneging on the result of the 2016 referendum. 
We acknowledge that just over half the people who voted, voted Leave. But it’s now over 2 years since the most recent referendum, and more and more information has come to light.

html: Honda at Swindon receives 2m components per day thanks to free movement of goods. After a no deal Brexit, to store the minimum 9 days' worth of components on site, they would need to erect the 3rd-largest building on Earth: 300,000 sq m = 42 football pitches. (source: FT 26.6.18)
